## Key Insights

- **Endless Mode Implementation**: Significant progress on Endless Mode (Issue #109) with compression capabilities added across the system, including new task types, worker capabilities, and archived output management.
- **Worker Capabilities System**: The decoupled architecture for worker capabilities (abstract capabilities vs. provider implementations) is now well-established, supporting both legacy and new functionality.
- **Repository Pattern Expansion**: The repository pattern has been extended with new interfaces for archived outputs and compression management, following the Unit of Work pattern.
- **Database Schema Evolution**: New database types (ArchivedOutputRecord, CompressionStatus) have been added to support Endless Mode's archiving and compression requirements.
- **Task System Enhancement**: The task queue system now includes compression tasks with ~95% token reduction capability, integrated into the existing priority-based queue architecture.
